children.value: So lets start this blog right?
Well as this is one of my first posts to the blog I figure that we should talk about the blog itself, freshly built just for this.

I have been meaning to write a blog now for a long time. Especially since I started getting into web development, well better late than never here we are. Me being stubborn and in the mindset of wanting to have things that I built, having a blog on a prebuilt system like Wordpress or something like that felt like a bit of a letdown and surely how hard could it be to make something from scratch right……. Here we are months and months later nearly finishing a blog, enough said.

One of the things I love about web development is the fact that it is never stalling or slowing down, the amount of things to know is growing at such a rapid pace that it at times has been incredibly daunting and at times has made me questions what I am doing here to begin with. I think this fact about the industry is one of the biggest reasons that I want to make Web Development my full time endeavour, being in an industry that is always evolving at such a rapid pace is an incredibly appealing thing to me.

So what took me so long with building this site? Well short answer is skill and decision making. I have been learning React for about 3-4 months now and I really like it, I am getting better and better about what it takes to build things and I love the component nature of the build. I started going through Scott Tolinski’s Pro Gatsby tutorial as well and was really interested in how fast Gatsby was.
So through doing the tutorial and then starting again to mould a new site to my needs the current stack for this site is as follows.
Contentful (Where my blog posts are hosted)
Netlify (Where the whole thing comes together)

So before this tutorial I had never used Gatsby, Never used GraphQL, had a little experience with Styled Components, Looked into Contentful but hadn’t built anything and had put a project on Netlify but never looked at some of the amazing things you can build into it. So this project was one hell of a learning experience to say the least.

Well as this is one of my first posts to the blog I figure that we should talk about the blog itself, freshly built just for this.

So lets start this blog right?

Well as this is one of my first posts to the blog I figure that we should talk about the blog itself, freshly built just for this.

I have been meaning to write a blog now for a long time. Especially since I started getting into web development, well better late than never here we are. Me being stubborn and in the mindset of wanting to have things that I built, having a blog on a prebuilt system like Wordpress or something like that felt like a bit of a letdown and surely how hard could it be to make something from scratch right……. Here we are months and months later nearly finishing a blog, enough said.

One of the things I love about web development is the fact that it is never stalling or slowing down, the amount of things to know is growing at such a rapid pace that it at times has been incredibly daunting and at times has made me questions what I am doing here to begin with. I think this fact about the industry is one of the biggest reasons that I want to make Web Development my full time endeavour, being in an industry that is always evolving at such a rapid pace is an incredibly appealing thing to me.

So what took me so long with building this site? Well short answer is skill and decision making. I have been learning React for about 3-4 months now and I really like it, I am getting better and better about what it takes to build things and I love the component nature of the build. I started going through Scott Tolinski’s Pro Gatsby tutorial as well and was really interested in how fast Gatsby was.

So through doing the tutorial and then starting again to mould a new site to my needs the current stack for this site is as follows.

  • React
  • Gatsby
  • GraphQL
  • Styled Components
  • Contentful (Where my blog posts are hosted)
  • Netlify (Where the whole thing comes together)

So before this tutorial I had never used Gatsby, Never used GraphQL, had a little experience with Styled Components, Looked into Contentful but hadn’t built anything and had put a project on Netlify but never looked at some of the amazing things you can build into it. So this project was one hell of a learning experience to say the least.
